gololang

Class Predefined

  • java.lang.Object
    • gololang.Predefined

  • public final class Predefined
extends java.lang.Object
    Predefined provides the module of predefined functions in Golo. The provided module is imported by default.

      • range

        public static java.lang.Object range(java.lang.Object from,
                                     java.lang.Object to)
        Makes an range object between two bounds. Range objects implement java.lang.Collection (immutable), so they can be used in Golo foreach loops.
        Parameters:
        from - the lower-bound (inclusive) as an Integer, Long, or Character.
        to - the upper-bound (exclusive) as an Integer, Long or Character
        Returns:
        a range object.
        See Also:
        Collection

      • range

        public static java.lang.Object range(java.lang.Object to)
        Makes an range object starting from the default value.

        The default value is 0 for numbers and 'A' for chars.

        Parameters:
        to - the upper-bound (exclusive) as an Integer or Long.
        Returns:
        a range object.
        See Also:
        range(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

      • reversedRange

        public static java.lang.Object reversedRange(java.lang.Object from,
                                             java.lang.Object to)
        Makes an decreasing range object between two bounds. Range objects implement java.lang.Collection, so they can be used in Golo foreach loops.
        Parameters:
        from - the upper-bound (inclusive) as an Integer, Long or Character.
        to - the lower-bound (exclusive) as an Integer, Long or Character.
        Returns:
        a range object.
        See Also:
        range(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

      • reversedRange

        public static java.lang.Object reversedRange(java.lang.Object from)
        Makes an decreasing range object up to the default value.

        The default value is 0 for numbers and 'A' for chars.

        Parameters:
        from - the upper-bound (inclusive) as an Integer, Long or Character.
        Returns:
        a range object.
        See Also:
        reversedRange(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object), range(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

        public static java.lang.Object asInterfaceInstance(java.lang.Object interfaceClass,
                                                   java.lang.Object target)
        Turns a function reference into an instance of a single-method interface.
        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - the target single-method interface class.
        target - the implementation function reference.
        Returns:
        an instance of interfaceClass.
        See Also:

      • asFunctionalInterface

        public static java.lang.Object asFunctionalInterface(java.lang.Object type,
                                                     java.lang.Object func)
                                              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Turns a function reference into an instance of a Java 8 functional interface. The implementation delegates to Golo adapter fabrics.
        Parameters:
        type - the functional interface class.
        func - the implementation function.
        Returns:
        an instance of type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if the adaptation fails.
        See Also:
        GoloAdapter

        public static java.lang.Object isClosure(java.lang.Object object)
        Test whether an object is a closure or not.
        Parameters:
        object - the object.
        Returns:
        true if object is an instance of FunctionReference false otherwise.

      • fun

        public static java.lang.Object fun(java.lang.Object name,
                                   java.lang.Object module,
                                   java.lang.Object arity)
                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Obtains a reference to a function.
        Parameters:
        name - the function name.
        module - the function enclosing module (a Java class).
        arity - the function arity, where a negative value means that any arity will do.
        Returns:
        a function reference to the matched function.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the target function could not be found.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument types are not of types (String, Class, Integer).
        java.lang.Throwable - if an error occurs.

      • fun

        public static java.lang.Object fun(java.lang.Object name,
                                   java.lang.Object module)
                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Obtains the first reference to a function.

        This is the same as calling fun(name, module, -1).

        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        fun(Object, Object, Object)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the content as a String.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • textToFile

        public static void textToFile(java.lang.Object text,
                              java.lang.Object file)
                       throws java.lang.Throwable
        Writes some text to a file. The file is created if it does not exist, and overwritten if it already exists.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to write.
        file - the file to write to as an instance of either String, File or Path.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • textToFile

        public static void textToFile(java.lang.Object text,
                              java.lang.Object file,
                              java.lang.Object charset)
                       throws java.lang.Throwable
        Writes some text to a file using the given Charset. The file is created if it does not exist, and overwritten if it already exists.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to write.
        file - the file to write to as an instance of either String, File or Path.
        charset - the charset to encode the text in.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the file exists, false if it doesn't

                                             java.lang.Integer idx)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • box

        public static java.lang.Object box(java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns a box containing the given object.

        Useful whenever an explicit reference is needed, for instance to create a closure with internal mutable state: 

            function counter = |init| {
      let current = box(init)
      return -> current: getAndSet(current: get() + 1)
    }

    let c = counter(3)
    c() # 3
    c() # 4
    c() # 5
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to reference.
        Returns:
        a java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference instance wrapping the object
